PageLayout.siteDescription: To those who want to change Europe, it is time to act! On May 5 to 8 2022, join the #StrasbourgSummit to make sure citizens’ expectations are followed with actions. #TimeToChangeEurope

newsletter.title: Keep me updated about the Strasbourg Summit

content.lead:
Before the Conference on the Future of Europe comes to an end, we invite all European civil society members to take part in the Strasbourg Summit from May 5 to 8 2022.

It is still uncertain whether the citizens' proposals made in the Conference will be taken into account. We will strive to ensure citizens' expectations are not left unheard and that European leaders follow and take action.
content.text:
Since May 9, 2021, all European citizens have been called upon to take part in the Conference on the Future of Europe to debate Europe's priorities and reflect on the future they wish to give it.

While this major debate is a unique opportunity to re-found Europe, there are a number of worrying signs as to what will actually happen. To date, the timetable and the ways in which aspirations will be taken into account remain uncertain. Furthermore, the unsuccessful follow-up to previous citizens' consultations in Europe gives little hope that the proposals made in the framework of the Conference on the Future of Europe will be taken into consideration.

Indeed, although European citizens have been given the floor many times to express their expectations, their contributions have often remained in the form of reports. Let's not let our words go unheard once again!

Far from resigning, European civil society therefore wishes to mobilise so that this moment of democracy does not remain without follow-up. The conclusions of the Conference on the Future of Europe in May 2022 are a unique opportunity for civil society to define the Europe it wants and for European leaders to translate it into action. The Strasbourg Summit on 5-8 May 2022 will push for it with all European civil society organisations.

Expectations are high. The Conference on the Future of Europe can lead to a sincere and in-depth reform carried out by the European institutions and involving its citizens, in particular the youngest. It can also bring about the changes that will give Europe the capacity to meet the challenges of our century, which concern us all, first and foremost climate change.

demands.title: What we strive for:
demands.supportProposals: Support <bold>citizens’ proposals</bold> made within the Conference on the Future of Europe
demands.civilSociety: Coordinate the European civil society in its actions and push European leaders to <bold>implement the proposals</bold> made during the Conference on the Future of Europe
demands.reform: Ask for <bold>the continuation of citizens’ works</bold> within a constituent Convention and push for an <bold>ambitious reform of the European Union<bold>

404.description: It looks like the page you’re looking for doesn't exist.

Programme.title: Programme
Programme.description: Before the Conference on the Future of Europe ends, we invite all civil society organisations across Europe to take part to the Strasbourg Summit from May 5 to 8 2022.
Programme.comingSoon: Programme in the making: come back soon or submit your own event!

contribute.title: Your own event?
contribute.subtitle:
The Strasbourg Summit programme is almost full! For any further contribution request, please contact us by email. 
 Thank you for your understanding. Looking forward to meeting you in Strasbourg on May 5-8, 2022!

umbrellas.economieSociale: Social economy, the future of Europe

convention.title: The European civil society Assembly
convention.description: Gathering all driving forces (associations, trade unions, NGOs, foundations, etc.) within an Assembly to set the roadmap following the Conference on the Future of Europe.
convention.part1: Discussion and round-tables with representatives of  European civil society organisations
convention.part2: Introducing the European civil society's joint declaration

march.title: March for Europe
march.description: Milestone of the Summit: let’s push European leaders to move from words to action and hold a large-scale citizen mobilisation to support the continuation of the European project.

TakePart.title: Take part
TakePart.description: Join the European civil society in Strasbourg on 5-8 May 2022 and take part to the highlights of the Strasbourg Summit. You can also contribute to the programme by arranging your own event during the Summit in order to share your expectations for the future of Europe.

delegation.name: Register your delegation
delegation.description: Each partner organisation of the Summit manages its own delegation. You too can participate in the Summit by registering your delegation!

costs.question: Will accommodation and travel costs be covered?
costs.answer:
The organisers of the Strasbourg Summit don’t cover the costs of accommodation and travel.

In order to plan your delegation's participation as well as possible, we are at your disposal to guide you in your choice of transport and accommodation. Please register and contact us!

accommodation.question: Where can I book accommodation in Strasbourg?
accommodation.answer:
The choice is yours! The Tourist Office offers a wide range of accommodation options in Strasbourg, which you can discover on their website.

Looking for affordable accommodation for your delegation? Here are some suggestions: Ciarus youth hostel, the European Youth Centre, Cap Europe hotel, The People youth hostel, Auberge des Deux Rives youth hostel.

come.question: How can I get to Strasbourg?
come.answer:
Getting to Strasbourg is easy. It is possible to come from most European cities by train, bus or plane. Strasbourg-Entzheim airport is located 10 minutes away by direct train from Strasbourg central train station. The train station is near the city centre and accessible by several tramway lines.

You can check the website of the Tourist Information Office for more information.

move.question: How can I get around Strasbourg during the event?
move.answer:
It is possible to walk between most of the venues of the Strasbourg Summit.

However, you can buy a 3-days ticket for €9.30 and use the tramway and bus. For information about fares and the public transport network, visit the CTS website.

event.name: Submit an event to the programme
event.description: Your organisation would like to organise an event in Strasbourg during the Strasbourg Summit? Tell us about your project and your needs and we will help you set it up.
event.full:
The Strasbourg Summit programme is almost full! For any further contribution request, please contact us by email. 
 Thank you for your understanding. Looking forward to meeting you in Strasbourg on May 5-8, 2022!

venue.question: If I organise an event, will you provide a venue?
venue.answer: Yes! The organisers of the Strasbourg Summit have booked venues for the events arranged by participating organisations. Once your event is confirmed by our team, we will offer a venue for you and will detail your technical needs. You will have the space for arranging your event free of charge: you just have to take care of the programme!

confirmation.question: When will I hear back when I submit my event?
confirmation.answer: Once you submitted the application form, our content and logistics team will respond to you via email. You will be able to confirm the logistical details of your session by discussing with them.

types.question: What kind of events can I organise?
types.answer:
You can organise any kind of indoor event with a European dimension. A debate, a discussion workshop, a meeting, a concert…

You are free to propose any kind of event that fits the venues. In short: we provide a venue, you organise your event.

online.question: Can I organise an online event during the Summit?
online.answer: No, all the events will be taking place in Strasbourg only.

measures.question: What will be the COVID-measures? Is a COVID pass mandatory?
measures.answer: We will follow the national instructions. However, since March 14 2022, the mask and COVID pass are no longer mandatory indoor.

cancel.question: What happens if the event is canceled because of COVID?
cancel.answer: If the health situation deteriorates, we will adapt the organisation of the Summit to keep it in the best possible conditions. In the event of cancellation, French law provides for the reimbursement of accommodation costs by hotels in case of COVID.

delegation.name: Join a delegation
delegation.description: Each partner organisation of the Summit manages its own delegation. Individual registrations outside a delegation are not possible.

how.question: How do I join?
how.answer: You must register with one of the Summit's partner organisations. This will allow us to welcome your delegation in the best conditions and to keep you informed of the events proposed during the Summit.

online.question: Will it be possible to attend the event online?
online.answer: No, all the events will be taking place in Strasbourg only.

costs.question: Will my travel and accommodation costs be covered by the Strasbourg Summit?
costs.answer:
The organisers of the Strasbourg Summit don’t cover the costs of accommodation and travel.

Several participating organisations support their participants with financial assistance. Please contact your organisation to have more information.

public.name: The general public programme
public.description:
Some events are open to the general public (they are indicated in the programme).

The March for Europe is open to all, you just need to show up on Saturday May 7 at 3 pm on place Kléber, Strasbourg wearing your most beautiful European or federalist flag!

measures.question: What will be the COVID-measures? Is a COVID pass mandatory?
measures.answer: We will follow the national instructions. However, since March 14 2022, the mask and COVID pass are no longer mandatory indoor.

cancel.question: What happens if the event is canceled because of COVID?
cancel.answer: If the health situation deteriorates, we will adapt the organisation of the Summit to keep it in the best possible conditions. In the event of cancellation, French law provides for the reimbursement of accommodation costs by hotels in case of COVID.

Organisations.title: They’re in
Organisations.description: A movement launched in 2021, the Strasbourg Summit is based on the involvement of multiple European civil society organisations, active across the whole continent.
